DataElement.preferredName: Sarcomatoid Renal Cell Carcinoma Histologic Classification Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A single character text field to record information related to a histologic classification of sarcomatoid renal cell carcinoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sarcomatoid Renal Cell Carcinoma Histologic Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A high grade carcinoma of the kidney.  It is not a distinct clinicopathological entity and includes a diverse group of renal cell carcinomas which have been transformed from a lower to a higher grade._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A high grade carcinoma of the kidney.  It is not a distinct clinicopathological entity and includes a diverse group of renal cell carcinomas which have been transformed from a lower to a higher grade. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A high grade carcinoma of the kidney.  It is not a distinct clinicopathological entity and includes a diverse group of renal cell carcinomas which have been transformed from a lower to a higher grade.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to histology.:Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
